thread.title: HARC adopts two villages in Uttarkashi
thread.title_full: HARC adopts two villages in Uttarkashi

author: tribuneindia.com
title: HARC adopts two villages in Uttarkashi
text:
Tribune News Service
Mussoorie, October 17
The Himalayan Action Research Centre (HARC), a non-profit organisation working in Uttarakhand since 1988, adopted Naini and Kemi villages in Uttarkashi district with an objective to assist the villagers in integrated and sustainable development based on indigenous knowledge. HARC officials distributed seeds to farmers to motivate them towards floriculture. The HARC officials said around 800 bulbs had been given to farmers interested in floriculture. The bulbs and the seeds would be planted in October and sold in the market in March at a minimum base price of around Rs 30 to Rs 40 per stem. The stems having four flowers would be sold at Rs 40 each, thus bringing additional revenue to the farmers.
